tripreview.Title: "Picturesque"
tripreview.sentence: A great view on the drive from Munnar to Thekkady.
The gap is a shear cliff,with winding roads.
You can click pics and can have tit bits by the road side.

tripreview.Title: "Breathtaking"
tripreview.sentence: The view is just breathtaking.
It makes you keep looking at it.
The tea gardens with rocks in between with all the greenery all around is so calming and beautiful that words are insufficient to describe the feeling and has to be experienced to be believed.

tripreview.Title: "the histroy behind is very interesting!"
tripreview.sentence: The gap is a shear cliff,with winding roads.
Built by the brtish back in 1920-50
Amazing place that is worth a visit.

tripreview.Title: "Excellent view point"
tripreview.sentence: Excellent view point from almost all along the road.
The tea garden access is now blocked, so one cannot enter the tea gardens now.

tripreview.Title: "Great View"
tripreview.sentence: A great view on the drive from Thekkady to Munnar.
The entire area is covered with tea gardens and a lake.
Great for taking snaps.

tripreview.Title: "Amazing View Points"
tripreview.sentence: The drive from Munnar to LockHart is brilliant.
Gets cloudy and misty at times and is a brilliant place to drive in fog.
The Lockhart estate also has a waterfall and close by is the tata tea factory and sales outlet.

tripreview.Title: "Place to meet the clouds !!!"
tripreview.sentence: This place is on the way to Thekaddy from Munnar.
Journey towards this place itself is absolutely stunning with tea gardens forming the green carpets all around.
The fresh mountain air, the mist-clad blue hills covered with lush greenery, winding roads and silver brooks splashing the emerald greenery with white streaks makes it worthy of a visit.
The climate and picturesque surroundings make it one of the most preferred locations to visit in Munnar.

tripreview.Title: "Lock Heart Gap, Munnar - Beautiful place to visit"
tripreview.sentence: Its good place to view.
Clouds will be passing every second , so you can enjoy the hill station view and its climate .
It will be full of clouds and mist.
Best time to visit , by morning 7 to 8 am.
For more information and photos on Munnar trip pls do visit http://mysouthindiatrips.
blogspot.
in/2013/08/munnar-thekkady-trip-august-2013.

tripreview.Title: "Disappointing"
tripreview.sentence: We visited Periyar Lake 40 years ago when the boat ride was in an open boat for about 20 people.
Then we saw lots of elephants.
Now there are at least 6 boats, each holding about 100 people.
Seats were 8 abreast on our boat, so if you were in the middle your view was rather restricted.
Since the sinking a few years ago you have to wear lifejackets all the time.
And we saw no elephants.
An ndian bison, some antelope and smaller beasts but all quite some distance away.

tripreview.Title: "Pleasant but no Wildlife"
tripreview.sentence: We got up very early to get the 1st boat out - meant to be the best for seeing wildlife.
When we arrived it was typically chaotic with little or no information about what to do or where to go
but you just work it out.
If you have a pre-printed ticket - you must still go to the small window to obtain your seat.
Life jackets are mandatory - essentially it was a pleasant ride around the lake but not much to see on our trip.

tripreview.Title: "A look from the seaside"
tripreview.sentence: The tour on the boat was pleasant and gave us many good looks of landscape, mammals and birds.
To slowly sit in front row and watch the life in this very special environment will give a relaxed way of travelling.
Recommend an early entry so the animals are at their best.
Be aware of the monkeys at the jetty.

tripreview.Title: "Okay to visit"
tripreview.sentence: Periyar lake is very huge.
It offers a boat ride - daily 5 rides with 5 to 6 boats each time containing around 100 - 120 travellers per boat.
It is better to go for the very first boat ride which starts around 7:30 in the morning.
However there would be huge rush for first ride so it is better to reach there at least 1 hr.

tripreview.Title: "Jungle Mein Mangal"
tripreview.sentence: The Lake Periyar is a Part of the Periyar Forest where animals come to have water, and take a bath during day.

tripreview.Title: "Had a decent boat ride"
tripreview.sentence: I went for boat ride at 9.30 AM slot.
Since it was not a season for animals to come out for water, their were only few animals I saw while boating.
I heard summer is the season where we can see maximum number of animals while boating.
Apart from this it was a very good experience travelling in boat between forest.

tripreview.Title: "In the lap of nature"
tripreview.sentence: Great place to see when you visit thekkady.
It will be better if you can buy online tickets for the boating to avoid any setbacks.

tripreview.Title: "Boat trip on the Lake"
tripreview.sentence: Boats operated by the Govt.
Authority are available daily at fixed times.
Big focus on safety.
Boats travel in groups.
Takes one round the lake.
This is Nature at its best.
If you are lucky you can see wild elephants, Bisons, deer, all kinds of birds and other wild animals.

tripreview.Title: "Awesome beauty"
tripreview.sentence: The periyar lake is simply awesome, you will feel the beauty the moment you enter the park.

tripreview.Title: "bamboo rafting"
tripreview.sentence: After reading bad reviews of the boat trip we decided to do the hike and bamboo raft package.
There was not much to see, the guides did not point out anything of interest throughout the trip.
We paddled 1/2 hour up one side of the lake which was very peaceful, not stunningly beautiful, then back.
Wish we had opted for the longer walk which went up to a high viewpoint.

tripreview.Title: "Amazingly beautiful and scenic"
tripreview.sentence: It was an amazing experience taking a boat ride in the serene and pristine Periyar lake.
What a feeling i must say.
If you have to take a boat ride would recommend to take the first one in the morning.
Tickets can be booked online as well.
Better do it online due to the rush at the counters.
Its a great 45 mins to 1 hour ride and great sun rise time.
Best time to view the animals by the lake is during the morning as they come to the banks for drinking water.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful lake with good views"
tripreview.sentence: Our experience at the lake was wonderful.
The water is very clear and calm.
Boating was one of the most exciting experiences we had in Thekkady.
We saw an elephant herd by the lake.
Get your tickets early to avoid long queues.

tripreview.Title: "nice lake view un polluted"
tripreview.sentence: can spend time amidst nature.
relax, there will be crowd on week ends so choose weekdays.
good to take a walk.

tripreview.Title: "Enjoy the Nature"
tripreview.sentence: We did boat ride over Periyar Lake.
It was awazing.
We saw different types of bird, sambal deer , wild elephant , wild boar , tortoise etc.
It was one hour boat side.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful Lake"
tripreview.sentence: The lake was beautiful and serene.
The boating was an average experience.
We hardly saw any animals at all and the boating cost was high.
The life jackets were not clean and were a pain to wear for the entire 1:30 hours.
The boat went at a very very slow pace.
You can give this a skip!

tripreview.Title: "Strikingly Beautiful"
tripreview.sentence: If you visit Thekkady this is a a must.
There are approximately 4 large boats which take visitors on a tour of the lake for around 1.5 hours, to take in both the beauty of the lake and (hopefully) to see the wild life.
We managed to see a variety of birds, an elephant, otters, boars and bison (there is no guarantee that you'll see anything in particular but there should be at least a few sites to see).
The boats take a predetermined course but don't all travel around together.
(There are other boats that sail around as well but they tend to be much smaller.
) NEED TO KNOW: 1.
BEST TIME: The first tour of the day offers the best viewing for birds and wild life (7:30am start).
TICKETS: Everyone runs (as soon as the gates open) to get tickets.
We stayed at the Aranya Nivas Hotel (just up the steps) and so could pre-book tiockets.
SEATING: Seat numbers are allocated BUT some of the chairs (garden chairs) aren't fixed to the floor so you suffer from 'people creep' i.e. you may end up with little space.
TIGERS: There are an estimated 42 tigers in the park.
Do not expect to see one!
Whilst I enjoyed the wild life I was just as impressed by the trees in the water which adds to the beauty.
(I'm told that these are remnants of the forest that was flooded to form the dam at the end of the 1800s).

tripreview.Title: "Average"
tripreview.sentence: Boating on a shared ferry was fun.
But actually not the worth they charge.
1:30 hrs boating to see hardly any animal.

tripreview.Title: "Serene beauty"
tripreview.sentence: A morning boat ride with booking in advance was a perfect way to start the day in Thekkady.
Gets a little crowded with a long queue of vehicles to the Periyar National Park, so make sure you start early.
And try the first boat to get a good view of animals and birds.

tripreview.Title: "Nice Scenic Boating but hardly any animals"
tripreview.sentence: Periyar Lake is likely the only activity Thekkady is famous for.
Boat gives you a scenic ride of Periyar lake for an hour or so and you might spot a few animals on sides.
NOTE: 1.
Ensure to book in advance.
There's very less chance for getting tickets there 2.
You need to book ticket individually for each person.
I saw many cases where couples came with one booking.
Fill the form twice and use same email Id.
Subsequent booking is much cheaper.
For example, if a person books first time it costs ~700.
But when another booking is done (for the spouse), it costs 281.
Ensure to carry or remember the ID you put TIP: Once you're through, a good option is to do a Jeep safari for some great scenic views.
It also gives you a small flavor of Tamil Nadu.

tripreview.Title: "Crazy public for boating"
tripreview.sentence: All the crowd is madly waiting for tickets to a 90 minute boat ride which does not seem worth at all.

tripreview.Title: "Boating"
tripreview.sentence: Very calm place and good viewing.
You need to carry good camera for beautiful pictures.
Carry your food to munch as you will not get anything on boat.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely lake boat ride at Periyar Lake"
tripreview.sentence: Had such a peaceful boat ride.
Did not get to spot the tiger or elephants but did see the wild boars and Sambar, and of course the naughty monkey population.

tripreview.Title: "Good Big Lake"
tripreview.sentence: Enjoyed our boat ride late in the afternoon.
It was rainy and monsoon season; obviously could not see any wild elephant.
I guess they come to drink water when water is scarce in the deep forest.

tripreview.Title: "Periyar Lake Safari"
tripreview.sentence: I would recommend to go on a 7:30 AM safari as the lake looks beautiful in the morning.
Don't expect fancy animals visit during the safari, we got to see one wild Elephant, some wild birds, Wild Pig and few small animals.
The morning tour is of 90 min and afternoon tour I guess if of 60 min but the charges are same.
the fare is Rs 225 per person for safari and 33 Rs per person for entry into Periyar Forest Reserve.
Entry ticket window opens at 6 am and I would recommend to reach the place at 6 am for 7:30 ride as later the queue gets bigger and there chances you might miss the ferry as there are limited seats.

tripreview.Title: "Nice place"
tripreview.sentence: This place is nice and peaceful when the crowd is minimal.
We were there on new years and lace was crowded.
There is a natural beauty.
The only frustrating part is entry for a foreigner is like 20 times more than an indian.
This is not a good sign of tourism as we indicate clear descrimnation.
This never happens in an any other country.

tripreview.Title: "not good"
tripreview.sentence: my mother father and sister is go with boat but not much to see in park also many items is very high charge.

tripreview.Title: "Boat ride"
tripreview.sentence: Relaxing boat ride over this lake but a bit slow.
if you are lucky you see animals.

tripreview.Title: "Artificial lake, but excellent wildlife on offer!"
tripreview.sentence: Periyar lake is the heart of the Tiger Reserve that goes by the same name.
The lake, albeit artificial, is beautiful and clean.

This was my third visit to the reserve and I've always loved the hour-and-a-half boat ride with guaranteed wildlife sightings (although the forest officials announce otherwise before the start of the boating).
We got to see elephants, gaur (Indian bison), sambar, wild boar, waterbirds, and terrapins, offering plenty of photography opportunities.
I'd recommend booking the boat ride tickets online, and selecting the evening's last trip (3:30 PM).

tripreview.Title: "The lake is great, the boating not so much"
tripreview.sentence: Ok
this is the kind of a review where you review something because you didn't get to see it.
We went to the lake, stood in the queue for close to 45 minutes, in the heat with a cranky kid, and did not get the ticket.
Well, they did stick a note saying that only 35 tickets are available.
But we were so optimistic .
You can book the tickets online, one ticket at a time, so if you are a group of 5 and unlucky, the tickets would have sold out by the time you book 3
leaving the other 2 watching forlornly as you sail away.
To be fair, the lake is beautiful and I am sure the boat trip is lovely too.
Despite the fact the boats did not inspire too much confidence.
I wish they allowed people without tickets also to go closer to the lake.
We could just see it from far, click some pics and return.

tripreview.Title: "Different experience"
tripreview.sentence: It's not an ordinary Lake, it is surrounded by Periyar National Park.
If you are a nature lover than you should visit it.
Enjoy 90 minutes boat ride in the lake.
Take tickets in advance, at least 30-60 minutes before.
Rate is Rs 225 per person (above 5 years of age).
You can see common wild animals like deer, bison, boar,black monkey etc during the ride, don't expect elephant and tiger.

tripreview.Title: "Great experience of boating!"
tripreview.sentence: The whole lake is famous for boating and wild life in the forest around the lake.
If you are lucky, then only you can see a tiger as the density of tiger population is very less here.
The boating tickets can be booked online also.
The full one and half hour boating is at a very reasonable cost.
Enjoyed the experience!

tripreview.Title: "Lake Cruise"
tripreview.sentence: It was wonderful to go by the cruise.
Very dreamy and serene.
We were trying to look for some animals.

tripreview.Title: "Great for spotting animals"
tripreview.sentence: We did a mistake by not buying the tickets for boat online.
There will be very limited amount of seats available, so if possible book it online a day in advance.
Each boat will take about 60-80 people and it will roam in the lake for 90 minutes.
We had taken the last trip of 3:30PM and spotted deers, wild boar, bison, elephant etc.
Though the elephant was quite faaaar.
;) I guess if you can catch the first trip which is around 7:30 AM i suppose.

tripreview.Title: "Worst place"
tripreview.sentence: Worst place to check in.
I haven't seen any animals when i went in for a boat drive.
Only one Elephant I have seen that too it is very long.
They are not driving the boat close to the shore.
getting the tickets in the weekend is so tough.
so better book through online.

tripreview.Title: "Few animals to be seen"
tripreview.sentence: Pied Kingfisher was the great discovery.
Aside from them, we saw a few wild boar in the distance and other birds.
This may well be much more worthwhile at a drier time of year when the wild animals have to come to the lake to get water.
The guide could have been more helpful in identifying what birds we did see.
However it was beautiful on the lake in the early morning pink glow.
My husband did not think it was worth the early rise.

tripreview.Title: "A memorable experiance"
tripreview.sentence: The boat ride in the Periyar lake in the early morning was a memorable experiance in the Kerala trip.
You may be lucky to see some wild animals.

tripreview.Title: "Awsome experience."
tripreview.sentence: The boating in river provide the opportunity to see the wildlife in close proximity with safety of water.
We saw a Bison family grazing the grass near by river and also beatiful birds on tree stumps.

tripreview.Title: ""Boating along Wildlife Watching ""
tripreview.sentence: This is a of type of boat ride tour which takes around 2.30 - 3.30 hours including the time waiting in the queue(starts in morning and ends around 5pm).
The boat is a big one like they have upper and lower area decks with plastic chair seatings.
We should watch for wildlife(Elephants , Wild Boar, Wild Pigs, Sambhar Deers, Birds, Tigers
) If you are lucky charm u can spot any of the above or else it is a peaceful long hour boat ride along the Western Ghats dense vegetation.
In monsoon times the water level is very high compared to the summers.
There are sooo many broken bark of trees lying in the la?
e scattered, which we can spot during our boating.
This area serves as shooting location for so many Indian Movies.
We can reach either through Tamilnadu(dindugal,theni, kumbum route) or via Kerala(thodupuzha, vagamon, kumily).
This is a beautiful calm place located in kumily which is around 12-15kms distance where we should drive through Periyar forest to reach the Periyar lake.
Those who are interested in boating with wildlife watching don't miss it(don't forget to ask for life jackets while boating).
Be cautious and don't run as a crowd to same side while boating to spot the wildlife.
Explore and Enjoy.
Happy Travelling!

tripreview.Title: "amazing place to visit for Couple"
tripreview.sentence: This one is must visit place for couple.
this one is famous for boat and nice nature scenery beauty.

tripreview.Title: "A memorable boat ride in Periyar Lake"
tripreview.sentence: I visited Kumily during the last Christmas holidays (Dec'15) and one of the areas of attraction is the Periyar Lake.
It is not a far drive from Kumily.
I went along with my family and took my own car.
If you are planning a trip to Thekkady or Munnar, ensure that you stop at Kumily one day for just this.
You won't regret it.
I'll share my experience with you all so that you are well prepared for this.
First things first.
The place is about 15kms from Kumily and is inside the Periyar forest.
The boat ride starts at 7.30 am and there are rides every two hours until 3.30pm.
Please book your tickets in advance and online if possible (search for periyar lake boat ride booking or periyarfoundation).
The site sucks.
You can only book 1 ticket at a time.
So people going in groups may have a challenge.
I had to book 5 times for my family.
The cost of tickets for Indian Nationals are about INR 285 for adults and INR 85 for children (Upto 11yrs).

Even if you buy tickets online, once you reach the inside the forest near the pier, you have to take tickets (yes yet again and I narrowly missed this) where the forest department folks will issue you the ticket with the seat numbers and the boat assigned to you (there are 3 boats, launches actually double decked ones) and you need to buy a ticket for your camera as well.
The second important tip, you need to reach the forest entrance atleast 1 hour or earlier if possible.
I reached around 630am for my 730am trip and had to stand in a queue of almost 50 vehicles.
You need to procure a ticket for your car before you can enter the forest area.
Once you enter the forest, you have to drive about 4 kms inside and park your vehicle.
And then you have to walk around 2 more kms to the pier.
You have food stalls and tea/coffee shops here just in case.
If you were not lucky and didn't get your online tickets, then ensure that you reach 2 hours before the scheduled trip time.
You have to encounter a very long queue for purchasing tickets at the gate before you can enter.
Tip number 3.
If you buy tickets online and when you are taking your tickets the 2nd time from the inside counter (yes and you need valid ID as well), you should try to get the Upper Deck seats.
It was very cold and windy the day I visited however the view is much better than the lower deck as the upper deck is open and the lower deck is not.
Moreover the outreach of the view is much more from the upper deck.
What to expect: Well it all depends on how much lady luck is on your side.
I was able to see wild bisons, wild pigs and boars, black bucks and few birds.
It is rumoured that you can see tigers if you are lucky, but, then I wasn't.
The trip lasts about 2 hours and it is really very enjoyable.
I hope you visit the place and have more luck than me!

tripreview.Title: "boat trip"
tripreview.sentence: We took a boat trip in the early morning which was really refreshing and could see a lot of animals around.

tripreview.Title: "Good boating experience and some animal sighting"
tripreview.sentence: If you can negotiate the online booking system that does not allow you to book more than one seat at a time (for reasons best known to the organisers) and then manage to find a seat on one of the boats, this can be an interesting half-day tour of the lake.
However, the seats on the boats are most uncomfortable and the life vests perhaps designed for submarines.
You are sure to see some wild life that makes the trip worthwhile.

tripreview.Title: "Totally amazing "
tripreview.Userloc: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
tripreview.sentence: Lovely.
No words to explain.

tripreview.Title: "A very Pleasant Boat ride"
tripreview.sentence: We were a group of 11 people of various age-group.
We had to purchase entry tickets Rs 33/- per head.
A jeep took us inside the area of Periyar Lake upto a certain point.
After having a pleasant walk in the winter morning, we had to stand in a Q to get our tickets for the 1-1/2 hour launch ride.
After a short wait we boarded the double-decker launch run by KTDC and also Kerala Forest Deptt.
3 boats left the jetty simaltenously.
Periyar is a huge lake and the driver of the launch tried his best to bring us closer to the animals roaming in the adjacent forest.
we saw a herd of wild elephants, sambar deers and wild buffaloes, beside a lot of birds.
the lake is a photographer's delight.
